numericCategories.name: Base Parameters
numericCategories.description: Parameters that may commonly be changed, e.g. based on a randomizer implementation or settings.

numerics.name: n_gateGlitchLenience
numerics.note: Number of failed attempts expected before a successful gate glitch attempt.
numerics.devNote: This applies to all types of gate glitches, green and blue, underwater and not.

numerics.name: n_speedKeepLenience
numerics.note: Number of failed attempts expected before a successful speed-keep.
numerics.devNote: This applies to speed-keeps on spikes or thorns, performing a frame-perfect unmorph.

numerics.name: n_spikeXModeLenience
numerics.note: Number of failed attempts expected before a successful spike X-mode attempt, where a 2-frame window for the unmorph is required.
devNote: This applies to X-mode on spikes. In exceptional cases it can also apply to thorns.

numerics.name: n_spikeSuitLenience
numerics.note: Number of failed attempts expected before a successful spike suit attempt.
numerics.devNote: This applies to spike suits with any applicable damage source, include spikes and thorns.

numerics.name: n_bombIntoCrystalFlashLenience
numerics.note: Number of failed attempts expected before a successful bomb into Crystal Flash attempt.

numerics.name: n_jumpIntoCrystalFlashLenience
numerics.note: Number of failed attempts expected before a successful jump mid-air morph into Crystal Flash attempt.

numerics.name: n_CrystalSparkLenience
numerics.note: Number of failed attempts expected before a successful Crystal Spark attempt.

numerics.name: n_elevatorCrystalFlashLenience
numerics.note: Number of failed attempts expected before a successful elevator Crystal Flash attempt.

numericCategories.name: Derived Parameters
numericCategories.description: Parameters defined in terms of the base parameters.

numerics.name: n_speedKeepAttempts
numerics.note: Total number of attempts expected for a successful speed-keep.

numerics.name: n_spikeXModeAttempts
numerics.note: Number of attempts expected to successfully perform a spike X-mode with a 2-frame window for the unmorph.
numerics.devNote: This applies to X-mode on spikes. In exceptional cases it can also apply to thorns.

numerics.name: n_thornXModeLenience
numerics.note: Number of failed attempts expected before a successful X-mode attempt on thorns, where a frame-perfect unmorph is required.
devNote: This applies to most cases of X-mode on thorns.
This is based on the speed-keep parameter, as the timing is the same.

numerics.name: n_thornXModeAttempts
numerics.note: Number of attempts expected to successfully perform X-mode on thorns (frame-perfect unmorph).
devNote: This applies to most cases of X-mode on thorns.
This is based on the speed-keep parameter, as the timing is the same.

numerics.name: n_spikeSuitAttempts
numerics.note: Number of attempts expected to successfully perform a spike suit.
